alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alachua; Western Alachua; Western Marion; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:11PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Alachua County through 245 PM EDT... At 211 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near University Of Florida, or 7 miles southwest of Gainesville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph, pea size hail, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Hawthorne, University Of Florida, Orange Heights, Gainesville Airport, Newnans Lake, Rochelle and Grove Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Alachua; Western Alachua; Western Marion; Western Putnam
